name: Mexico
introduction: The site of several advanced Amerindian civilizations - including the Olmec Toltec Teotihuacan Zapotec Maya and Aztec - Mexico was conquered and colonized by Spain in the early 16th century. Administered as the Viceroyalty of New Spain for three centuries it achieved independence early in the 19th century. Elections held in 2000 marked the first time since the 1910 Mexican Revolution that an opposition candidate - Vicente FOX of the National Action Party (PAN) - defeated the party in government the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI). He was succeeded in 2006 by another PAN candidate Felipe CALDERON but Enrique PENA NIETO regained the presidency for the PRI in 2012. The global financial crisis in late 2008 caused a massive economic downturn in Mexico the following year although growth returned quickly in 2010. Ongoing economic and social concerns include low real wages high underemployment inequitable income distribution and few advancement opportunities for the largely indigenous population in the impoverished southern states. Since 2007 Mexico's powerful drug-trafficking organizations have engaged in bloody feuding resulting in tens of thousands of drug-related homicides.
overview: 'Mexico is a country between the U.S. and Central America that''s known for its Pacific and Gulf of Mexico beaches and its diverse landscape of mountains deserts and jungles. Ancient ruins such as Teotihuacán and the Mayan city of Chichén Itzá are scattered throughout the country as are Spanish colonial-era towns. In capital Mexico City upscale shops renowned museums and gourmet restaurants cater to modern life.'

languages.name: Afro-Seminole Creole
languages.area: Bracketville, Texas. Also in Mexico.

languages.name: Aguacateco
languages.area: Western Huehuetenango Department.

languages.name: South Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Egypt, Israel, Kuwait, Libya, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Puerto Rico, Syria.

languages.name: Guerrero Amuzgo
languages.area: Southeast Guerrero, Xochistlahuaca municipality, Zacoalpan, Cochoapa, Huehuetonoc, Tlacoachistlahuaca, Guadalupe Victoria, Cozoyoapan, Huistepec, and Rancho del Cura. Santa Catarina River separates Guerrero variety from Oaxaca varieties.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: San Pedro Amuzgos Amuzgo
languages.area: Southwest Oaxaca, Putla District, San Pedro Amuzgos; outlying settlements.

languages.name: Ipalapa Amuzgo
languages.area: Oaxaca, Putla District: Santa María Ipalapa, 5–8 km northeast of San Pedro Amuzgos, 5km off Highway 125 Tlaxiaco to coast, La Ciénaga.

languages.name: Highland Puebla Nahuatl
languages.area: Northeast Puebla.

languages.name: Belize Kriol English
languages.area: Most in Belize City; rural villages; along the coast; waterways. Also in United States.

languages.name: Chuj
languages.area: Central western Coatán River area, west Huehuetenango Department.

languages.name: Car Nicobarese
languages.area: North Nicobar Islands, Car Island.

languages.name: Catalan
languages.area: Northeast, around Barcelona; Catalonia, Valencia provinces, Balearic Islands; Carche region, Murcia Province. Menorquin is Menorca. Pallarese, in Pallars. Ribagorçan from Aran Valley to south of Tamarit, and from Noguera Ribagorçana to border with Aragonese. Also in Algeria, Andorra, Argentina, Belgium, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Dominican Republic, France, Germany, Italy, Mexico, Switzerland, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela.

languages.name: Comaltepec Chinantec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, Santiago Comaltepec, Soledad Tectitlán, La Esperanza, San Martín Soyolapan, Vista Hermosa (Quiotepec), San Pedro Yolox, Rosario Temextitlán, Maninaltepec.

languages.name: Highland Oaxaca Chontal
languages.area: Southernmost part of Oaxaca, west of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, San José Chiltepec, San Lucas Ixcatepec, plus 15 towns.

languages.name: Tabasco Chontal
languages.area: North central and south Tabasco. 21 towns.

languages.name: Ojitlán Chinantec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, San Lucas Ojitlán, including 4 towns and 15 rancherías, and Veracruz, Hidalgotitlán and Minatitlán municipalities. Most relocated because a dam flooded their land in 1991.

languages.name: Quiotepec Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Ixtlán District: San Juan Quiotepec, Reforma, Maninaltepec, San Pedro Yolox, Rosario Temextitlán; Oaxaca, Etla District: San Juan Bautista Atatlah.

languages.name: Ozumacín Chinantec
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, 3 towns: San Pedro Ozumacín, Ayotzintepec, Santiago Progreso.

languages.name: Chiapanec
languages.area: State of Chiapas, El Bosque (2), Las Margaritas (2), Ocosingo (4), Palenque (2), Sabanilla (7).

languages.name: Lealao Chinantec
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, San Juan Lealao, Latani, Tres Arroyos, and La Hondura.

languages.name: Lowland Oaxaca Chontal
languages.area: South Oaxaca, Tehuantepec District, San Pedro Huamelula and Santiago Astata.

languages.name: Eastern Highland Chatino
languages.area: Southeast Oaxaca, Lachao Pueblo Nuevo, Santa María Yolotepec villages.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Lalana Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca-Veracruz border, 25 towns in Lalana Minicipio, Jocotepec Minicipio, and Petlapa Municipio districts.

languages.name: Tepetotutla Chinantec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, Santa Cruz Tepetotutla, San Antonio del Barrio, San Pedro Tlatepusco, Santo Tomás Texas, Vega del Sol, El Naranjal.

languages.name: Chicomuceltec
languages.area: Chiapas, Mazapa de Madero, Amatenango, and Chicomuselo towns. Also in Guatemala.

languages.name: Cocopa
languages.area: Baja California, El Mayor, San Poza de Aroizú (to the south of Río San Luis Colorado). Also in United States.

languages.name: Cochimi
languages.area: Baja California Norte, north of Loreto to the northern part of the peninsula.

languages.name: Santa Teresa Cora
languages.area: North central Nayarit, Santa Teresa, Dolores, San Blasito.

languages.name: Chochotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán District, Santa María Nativitas, San Juan Bautista Coixtlahuaca, San Miguel Tulancingo.

languages.name: Palantla Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Juan Palantla plus more than 21 towns.

languages.name: El Nayar Cora
languages.area: North central Nayarit. Also in United States.

languages.name: Chiltepec Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San José Chiltepec.

languages.name: Sochiapam Chinantec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, Cuicatlán: San Pedro Sochiapan, Retumbadero, San Juan Zautla, Santiago Quetzalapa, San Juan Zapotitlán.

languages.name: Tataltepec Chatino
languages.area: Southeast Oaxaca, Juquila District, extreme west lowland Chatino area, Tataltepec de Valdez and San Pedro Tututepec towns; a few in nearby Spanish centers.

languages.name: Tepinapa Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Choapan District, Santiago Jocotepec Municipio: San Pedro Tepinapa Ejidal, San Pedro Tepinapa Comunal (locally known as Monte de Oro), Linda Vista; San Juan Petlapa Municipio: Santa María Lovani, San Juan Toavela, and Santa Isabel Cajonos. Very remote.

languages.name: Tlacoatzintepec Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Juan Bautista Tlacoatzintepec, San Pedro Alianza, Santiago Quetzalapa, San Juan Zapotitlán.

languages.name: Western Highland Chatino
languages.area: Southwest Oaxaca, Juquila District, Panixtlahuaca, San Juan Quiahije, Yaitepec towns; Ixtapan, Tepenixtelahuaca, Ixpantepec, Amialtepec villages; some rancherías.

languages.name: Chol

languages.name: Zacatepec Chatino

languages.name: Usila Chinantec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Felipe Usila plus 12 towns; 1 in Veracruz (Pueblo Doce).

languages.name: Teutila Cuicatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Teutila. 8 towns.

languages.name: Tepeuxila Cuicatec
languages.area: Northwest Oaxaca. 16 towns.

languages.name: Valle Nacional Chinantec

languages.name: Nopala Chatino
languages.area: Southeast Oaxaca, Juquila District, Santos Reyes Nopala, Santa María Texmaxcaltepec, San María Magdalena Tiltepec, Teotepec, Cerro el Aire, Santiago Cuixtla, Atotonilco, San Gabriel Mixtepec.

languages.name: Zenzontepec Chatino
languages.area: Southeast Oaxaca, Juquila District, Santa Cruz Zenzontepec and San Jacinto Tlacotepec municipalities, former Santa María Tlapanalquiahuitl municipality.

languages.name: German
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hungary, Israel, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Moldova, Mozambique, Namibia, Paraguay, Philippines, Poland, Puerto Rico, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United States, Uruguay, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Modern Greek (1453-)
languages.area: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Also in Albania, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, France, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey (Europe), Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Basque
languages.area: France-Spain border, 3 Basque provinces: Alava (Araba), Bizkaia (Biskay), and Gipuzkoa of Autonomous Basque Community (CAV); north central Spain, Autonomous Region of Navarra (Nafarroa), north area. Also in Australia, Costa Rica, France, Mexico, Philippines, United States.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Galician
languages.area: Northwest Spain, Galicia Autonomous Region. Also in Portugal.

languages.name: Swiss German
languages.area: Central, south central, north central, northeast, and east cantons. Also in Austria, France, Germany, Liechtenstein.

languages.name: Haitian
languages.location: Creole Languages of the Northern Caribbean
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Bahamas, Canada, Cayman Islands, Dominican Republic, French Guiana, Guadeloupe, Puerto Rico, Turks and Caicos Islands, United States.

languages.name: Huichol
languages.area: Northeast Nayarit and northwest Jalisco. Main centers: Guadalupe Ocotán, Nayarit, San Andrés Cohamiata, Jal., San Sebastián, Jal., Santa Catarina, Jal., Tuxpan de Bolaños, Jal.

languages.name: San Francisco Del Mar Huave
languages.area: Southeast coast, Oaxaca, Juchitán District, San Francisco del Mar, old and new town.

languages.name: Huastec

languages.name: San Mateo Del Mar Huave

languages.name: San Dionisio Del Mar Huave

languages.name: Santa María Del Mar Huave

languages.name: Italian
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Egypt, Eritrea, France, Germany, Israel, Libya, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malta, Paraguay, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Romania, San Marino, Saudi Arabia, Slovenia, Somalia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Vatican State.

languages.name: Ixil

languages.name: Popti'

languages.name: Western Juxtlahuaca Mixtec

languages.name: Japanese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in American Samoa, Argentina, Australia, Belize, Brazil, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Guam, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Palau, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Kekchí
languages.area: Northern Alta Verapaz, southern Petén departments in Guatemala. Also in Belize, El Salvador.

languages.name: Kickapoo

languages.name: Q'anjob'al
languages.area: Huehuetenango Department, Santa Eulalia. Also in United States.

languages.name: Kiliwa
languages.area: Baja California Norte, Arroyo León, Agua Escondida, La Parra southeast of Ensenada, south of the Paipai, Tipai, and Cocopa.

languages.name: Western Kanjobal
languages.area: San Miguel Acatán. Also in Mexico, United States.

languages.name: Korean
languages.area: Also in American Samoa, Australia, Bahrain, Belize, Brazil, Brunei, Canada, China, Germany, Guam, Japan, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Kyrgyzstan, Libya, Mauritania, Mongolia, Mozambique, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Suriname, Tajikistan, Thailand, Turkmenistan, United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Lacandon
languages.area: Southeast Chiapas, Najá, Lacanjá San Quintín, Metzaboc, Betel, Lake Metzaboc.

languages.name: San Jerónimo Tecóatl Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Jerónimo Tecóatl, San Lucas Zoquiapan, Santa Cruz Acatepec, San Antonio Eloxochitlán, San Pedro Ocopetatillo, San Lorenzo, Santa Ana municipalities, and a few in Puebla. 12 towns.

languages.name: Yutanduchi Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán District, Yutanduchi de Guerrero.

languages.name: Jalapa De Díaz Mazatec
languages.area: North Oaxaca and Veracruz. 13 towns.

languages.name: Mam
languages.area: Western Huehuetenango Department (San Sebastián and other towns) and San Marcos Department; 17 towns. Dialects spoken in San Miguel Ixtahuacán (18,000) and Concepción Tutapa (30,000) towns. Also in Mexico.

languages.name: Chiquihuitlán Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: San Francisco Matlatzinca
languages.area: State of Mexico. San Francisco de los Ranchos.

languages.name: Huautla Mazatec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, Huautla and vicinity.

languages.name: Central Mazahua
languages.area: West and northwest state of Mexico.

languages.name: Amoltepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, west edge of Sola de Vega District, Santiago Amoltepec Municipio, and settlements (Las Cuevas, La Mesilla, El Armadillo, El Mamey, El Zapote, Colonia de Jesús, Barranca Oscura, Llano Tigre, Llano Conejo, El Cocal, El Laurel, La Tortuga). 20 villages in southern part of Santiago Amoltepec Municipio.

languages.name: Itundujia Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Putla District, southwest of Yosondúa, southeast of Putla. Most in Morelos and Guerrero villages.

languages.name: Coatlán Mixe
languages.area: East central Oaxaca, including Coatlán, Camotlán, San José, Santa Isabel, Ixcuintepec.

languages.name: Santa Lucía Monteverde Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca, northeast Putla District, Santa Lucía Monteverde town.

languages.name: Southwestern Tlaxiaco Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Mexican Sign Language
languages.area: Widespread, except in some American Indian areas (see Yucatec Mayan Sign Language [msd]): Mexico D.F. Guadalajara, Monterrey, Hermosillo, Morelia, Veracruz, Oaxaca, San Luis Potosí, Querétaro, Puebla, Cuernavaca, Torreón, Saltillo, Toluca.

languages.name: Mayo
languages.area: Coastal south Sonora around Navojoa (Huatabampo); north Sinaloa (Los Mochis, Guasave, San José Ríos, north of Guamuchil). 100 villages or more.

languages.name: Mocho
languages.area: Chiapas, on Guatemala Mexico border, Tuzantán and Motozintla.

languages.name: Atatláhuca Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca, San Esteban Atatláhuca, and Santa Catarina Yosonotú towns.

languages.name: Ocotepec Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca.

languages.name: San Miguel El Grande Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca.

languages.name: Chayuco Mixtec
languages.area: Southwest Oaxaca.

languages.name: Chigmecatitlán Mixtec
languages.area: Puebla, due south of Puebla City, halfway to Oaxaca border, Santa Catarina Tlaltemplan.

languages.name: Peñoles Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca. Santa María Peñoles municipalities, Monteflor, San Mateo Tepantepec, Estetla, and Cholula agencias; Santiago Tlazoyaltepec municipalities; Huitepec municipalities, Huazolotipac agencia. Also in United States.

languages.name: Alacatlatzala Mixtec
languages.area: East Guerrero, southwest to south of Tlapa in Alacatlatzala, Cahuatache, Tenaztalcingo, Jilotepec, Zacatipa, Tototepec, Cuba Libre, San Isidro Labrador, Quiahuitlatlatzala, Xonacatlán, Tepecocatlán, Cuautipa, Ocuapa, Potoichan towns. Tiny communities in Acapulco, Guerrero; Cuautla, Morelos; Culiacán, Sinaloa, also near San Quintín, Baja California. Some emigration to USA, especially New York.

languages.name: Pinotepa Nacional Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Jamiltepec District.

languages.name: Apasco-Apoala Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, north northwest of Nochixtlán, San Miguel Chicahua, Jocotipac, Santa María Apasco, San Miguel Huautla, Nduayaco, and other towns.

languages.name: Isthmus Mixe
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, throughout San Juan Guichicovi Municipality, near Veracruz border, Isthmus of Tehuantepec. 3 towns.

languages.name: Southern Puebla Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southwest Puebla, Zapotitlán Palmas town.

languages.name: Cacaloxtepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Santiago Cacaloxtepec town.

languages.name: Mixtepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Juan Mixtepec, Tlaxiaco (district head), San Quintín valley, Baja California; Arby, Lamont, California; Santa María, California; and Oregon, USA. Also in United States.

languages.name: Ayutla Mixtec
languages.area: Guerrero, Ayutla.

languages.name: Coatzospan Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: San Juan Colorado Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Silacayoapan Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Santo Domingo Tonala, San Jorge Nuchita, Tijuana towns. Also in United States.

languages.name: Michoacán Mazahua
languages.area: East Michoacán.

languages.name: Yosondúa Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Tlazoyaltepec Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca, Santiago Tlazoyaltepec municipality.

languages.name: Yucatec Maya Sign Language
languages.area: Concentrated in south central Yucatán, sizeable concentration in northern Quintana Roo (1999 H. Smith). Chican, formerly called ‘Nohya’ (a pseudonym thought necessary at first to protect the deaf population), Yucatán. Isolated villages (at least 2 in Oxkutzcab, 4 in Xyatil, 1 in Carillo Puerto) throughout a wide portion of lowland Mayan region. Kinil is also mentioned (1997 H. Smith).

languages.name: Totontepec Mixe
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, north of Zacatepec. 10 towns.

languages.name: Tututepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca. San Pedro Tututepec, Santa María Acatepec, Santa Cruz Tututepec, other towns.

languages.name: Tidaá Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Yucuañe Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, northeast Tlaxiaco District, San Bartolomé Yucuañe. Many work in D.F. and USA.

languages.name: Northwest Oaxaca Mixtec
languages.area: Northwest Oaxaca, Santos Reyes Yucuná, Guadalupe Portezuelo, and San Simón Zahuatlán towns.

languages.name: Tezoatlán Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tezoatlán area, southwest of Huajuapan, south of Cacaloxtepec; Yucuquimi de Ocampo, San Andrés Yutatío, Yucuñuti de Benito Juárez, San Juan Diquiyú, San Marcos de Garzón, San Martín del Río, Santa Catarina Yotandú, San Isidro de Zaragoza, San Valentín de Gomez towns.

languages.name: Tlahuitoltepec Mixe
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca; central Oaxaca, around Albarradas Zapoteco. 3 towns.

languages.name: Huitepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, west of Zaachila, southwest of Peñoles, Huitepec Municipio, San Antonio Huitepec, Santiago Huajolotipac, and San Francisco Yucucundo towns. Some near Ensenada, Baja California.

languages.name: Jamiltepec Mixtec
languages.area: Southwest Oaxaca.

languages.name: Metlatónoc Mixtec
languages.area: East Guerrero, Metlatónoc, San Rafael, towns further south; Municipalities: Tlacoachistlahuaca and Cochoapa.

languages.name: Southeastern Nochixtlán Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán District, southeast of Nochixtlán. Santo Domingo Nuxaá, San Andrés Nuxiño, Santa Inés de Zaragoza, Ojo de Agua Nuxaá, El Oro, La Herradura, La Unión Zaragoza, Reforma, La Paz.

languages.name: Santa María Zacatepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, south of Putla, Tapanco, Nejapa, Atotonilco, San Miguel, San Juan Viejo, Rancho de la Virgen, Las Palmas towns.

languages.name: Ixcatlán Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Chichicazapa, Nuevo Ixcatlán, San Pedro Ixcatlán towns.

languages.name: Mazatlán Mixe
languages.area: East Oaxaca. 7 towns.

languages.name: Coatepec Nahuatl
languages.area: Mexico state, Coatepec Costales, Tlacultlapa, Texcalco, Tonalapa, Maxela, Machito de las Flores, Chilacachapa, Miacacsingo, Los Sabinos, and Acapetlahuaya, all west of Iguala, Guerrero. Strongest usage in Coatepec Costales and Chilacachapa.

languages.name: Central Huasteca Nahuatl
languages.area: Hidalgo, Veracruz, and San Louis Potosi states.

languages.name: Northern Puebla Nahuatl
languages.area: North Puebla, Naupan.

languages.name: Michoacán Nahuatl
languages.area: Michoacán, Maruata Pómaro coastal settlement.

languages.name: Central Puebla Nahuatl
languages.area: South of Puebla City in Teopantlán, Tepatlaxco de Hidalgo, Tochimilco, Atoyatempan, Huatlathauca, Huehuetlán near Molcaxac.

languages.name: North Central Mixe
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, northeast part of the Mixe District, several towns, including those listed as dialects.

languages.name: Guerrero Nahuatl
languages.area: Balsas River: Tepecoacuilco de Trujano, Huitzuco de los figueroa, Atenango del Río, Copalillo, Mártir de Cuilapan, Zitlala, Tixtla de Guerrero, Mochitlán, Quechultenango, Chiulapa de Álvarez, Ahuacuotzingo, Olinalá, Atlixtac, Zapotitlan Tablas, Ayutla de los Libres, Cualác, Huamuxtitlán, Xochihuehuetlán, Tlapa de Comonfort, Alpoyeca, Xalpatláhuac, and Alcozauca de Guerrero municipalities.

languages.name: Tabasco Nahuatl
languages.area: Tabasco, Cupilco and Tecominoacan.

languages.name: Eastern Huasteca Nahuatl
languages.area: Huautla, Hidalgo the center; Puebla, Veracruz. 1,500 villages.

languages.name: Tetelcingo Nahuatl
languages.area: Morelos, Tetelcingo.

languages.name: Zacatlán-Ahuacatlán-Tepetzintla Nahuatl
languages.area: North of Puebla City, Zacatlán: San Miguel Tenango, Xonotla, Zoquitla, Yehuala, Cuacuilco, Cuacuila, Tetelatzingo, Tlalitzlipa; Ahuacatlán: Cualtepec, Ixquihuacán; Tepetzintla: Xochitlasco, Tenantitla, Chachayohquila, Santa Catarina Omitlán.

languages.name: Isthmus-Cosoleacaque Nahuatl
languages.area: Veracruz, Cosoleacaque, Oteapan, Jáltipan de Morelos, Hidalgotitlán, Soconusco.

languages.name: Morelos Nahuatl
languages.area: Morelos state, municipality Temixco, Cuentepec; municipality Miacatlán, Coatetelco; municipality Tepoztlán, Santa Catarina; municipality Tetela del Volcán, Hueyapan, Alpanocan; municipality Puente de Ixtla, Xoxocotla. state of Puebla (on the border to Morelos): municipality Acteopan, San Marcos Acteopan, San Felipe Toctla.

languages.name: Central Nahuatl
languages.area: Tlaxcala and Puebla States.

languages.name: Isthmus-Pajapan Nahuatl
languages.area: Veracruz, Pajapan, San Juan Volador, Santanón, Sayultepec, Jicacal towns.

languages.name: Huaxcaleca Nahuatl
languages.area: Puebla in Chichiquila and Chilchotla towns.

languages.name: Ometepec Nahuatl
languages.area: South Guerrero, Arcelia, Acatepec, Quetzalapa de Azoyú, Rancho de Cuananchinicha, and El Carmen; Oaxaca, Juxtlahuaca District, Cruz Alta and San Vicente Piñas towns; and Putla District, Concepción Guerrero.

languages.name: Temascaltepec Nahuatl
languages.area: State of Mexico, San Mateo Almomoloa, Santa Ana, La Comunidad, and Potrero de San José, southwest of Toluca.

languages.name: Western Huasteca Nahuatl
languages.area: Tamazunchale, San Luis Potosí is center; Hidalgo. 1,500 villages.

languages.name: Isthmus-Mecayapan Nahuatl
languages.area: South Veracruz, Mecayapan Municipio, Mecayapan and Tatahuicapan towns.

languages.name: Northern Oaxaca Nahuatl
languages.area: Northwest Oaxaca, near Southeast Puebla Náhuatl, Santa María Teopoxco, San Antonio Nanahuatipan, San Gabriel Casa Blanca, Teotitlán del Camino, San Martín Toxpalan, Ignacio Zaragosa, Apixtepec, El Manzano de Mazatlán, Cosolapa, Tesonapa (one of the last 2 towns in Veracruz). In Puebla: Coxcatlán.

languages.name: Santa María La Alta Nahuatl
languages.area: Puebla, Santa María la Alta, Atenayuca. A pocket northwest of Tehuacán, off Puebla-Tehuacán highway.

languages.name: Orizaba Nahuatl
languages.area: Veracruz, Orizaba area.

languages.name: Southeastern Puebla Nahuatl
languages.area: Southeast Puebla, Tehuacán region, Chilac and San Sebastián Zinacatepec area.

languages.name: Sierra Negra Nahuatl
languages.area: South Puebla. 13 towns.

languages.name: Northern Tepehuan
languages.area: South Chihuahua, Baborigame area.

languages.name: Tlamacazapa Nahuatl
languages.area: Tlamacazapa, 1 hour from Taxco.

languages.name: Atzingo Matlatzinca
languages.area: State of Mexico, Ocuilan municipality, San Juan Atzingo, Santa Lucía del Progreso.

languages.name: Tohono O'odham
languages.area: South central Arizona. 60 villages on 7 reservations. Also in Mexico.

languages.name: Opata
languages.area: Sonora: Nacori, Bacahora, Suaqui, Sahuaripa, Arivechi, Onavas. Tecoripa is traditional area.

languages.name: Mezquital Otomi
languages.area: Hidalgo, Mezquital Valley; Florida, USA. Also in United States.

languages.name: Tilapa Otomi
languages.area: State of Mexico, Santiago Tilapa, between Mexico, D.F. and Toluca.

languages.name: Eastern Highland Otomi
languages.area: Hidalgo, Huehuetla and San Bartolo; Veracruz, Tlachichilco and Ixhuatlán.

languages.name: Tenango Otomi
languages.area: Hidalgo, Puebla, San Nicolás.

languages.name: Querétaro Otomi
languages.area: Amealco Municipio: San Ildefonso, Santiago Mexquititlán; Acambay Municipio; Tolimán Municipio.

languages.name: Estado de México Otomi
languages.area: State of Mexico.

languages.name: Temoaya Otomi
languages.area: State of Mexico, Temoyaya Municipio, San Pedro Arriba, San Pedro Abajo, Enthavi, Solalpan, Jiquipilco el Viejo. 16 barrios.

languages.name: Texcatepec Otomi
languages.area: Northwest Veracruz, Texcatepec Municipio: Texcatepec, Ayotuxtla, Tzicatlán; Zontecomatlán Municipio: Hueytepec, Amajac.

languages.name: Ixtenco Otomi
languages.area: Tlaxcala, San Juan Bautista Ixtenco.

languages.name: Mezontla Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla. 1 town.

languages.name: Coyotepec Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla, west of Tehuacán City, east of Ahuatempan, Coyotepec, and San Mateo.

languages.name: Central Pame
languages.area: San Luis Potosí, Santa María Acapulco.

languages.name: Santa Inés Ahuatempan Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla, west of Coyotepec and Tehuacán. 2 towns.

languages.name: Plautdietsch
languages.area: Ontario, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Alberta, British Columbia. Also in Argentina, Belize, Bolivia, Brazil, Costa Rica, Germany, Kazakhstan, Mexico, Paraguay, Russian Federation (Europe), United States, Uruguay.

languages.name: Chichimeca-Jonaz
languages.area: State of Guanajuato, San Luís de la Paz, Jonáz village.

languages.name: Pima Bajo
languages.area: Central Sonora-Chihuahua border, scattered.

languages.name: Oluta Popoluca
languages.area: Southeast Veracruz, Oluta, inland, west of Texistepec.

languages.name: San Marcos Tlacoyalco Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla, San Marcos Tlacoyalco.

languages.name: Northern Pame
languages.area: San Luis Potosí, Ciudad del Maíz, Alaquines, Tamasopo, Rayón Municipalities.

languages.name: Southern Pame
languages.area: Jiliapan.

languages.name: San Juan Atzingo Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla, San Juan Atzingo.

languages.name: Highland Popoluca
languages.area: Veracruz, Soteapan.

languages.name: Texistepec Popoluca
languages.area: Southeast Veracruz, Texistepec, east of Oluta.

languages.name: Portuguese
languages.area: Iberia, Azores, Madeira. Also in Andorra, Angola, Antigua and Barbuda, Belgium, Bermuda, Brazil, Canada, Cape Verde Islands, China, Congo, East Timor, France, Germany, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, India, Indonesia (Nusa Tenggara), Jamaica, Luxembourg, Malawi, Mozambique, Netherlands Antilles, Oman, Paraguay, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, São Tomé e Príncipe, Senegal, South Africa, Spain, Suriname, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela, Zambia.

languages.name: Sayula Popoluca
languages.area: Veracruz, Sayula.

languages.name: San Felipe Otlaltepec Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla. 3 towns: San Felipe Otlaltepec, Santa María Nativitas, Huejonapan.

languages.name: Paipai
languages.area: Santa Catarina, Los Pocitos in Valle de la Trinidad, Estado Valle de la Trinidad, Rancho Aguascalientes or La Palmita; Baja California Norte, Ensenada, south of the Diegueño.

languages.name: San Luís Temalacayuca Popoloca
languages.area: Puebla, San Luís Temalacayuca.

languages.name: Western Highland Purepecha
languages.area: Michoacán, western mountains, Zamora on north edge, Los Reyes de Salgado on southwest corner, Paracho on east edge, including Pamatácuaro. Also in United States.

languages.name: Quetzaltepec Mixe
languages.area: Northeast Oaxaca, northeastern part of the Mixe District, several towns including those listed as dialects.

languages.name: K'iche'
languages.area: Central highlands, Totonicapán, southern El Quiché, eastern Sololá, eastern Quezaltenango departments.

languages.name: Vlax Romani
languages.area: Also in Albania, Argentina, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, Colombia, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Mexico, Moldova, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Seri
languages.area: Sonora coast. 2 villages.

languages.name: Spanish
languages.area: Central, south; Canary Islands. Also in Andorra, Anguilla, Argentina, Aruba, Australia, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Canada, Cayman Islands, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Finland, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Guatemala, Honduras, Israel, Jamaica, Mexico, Morocco, Netherlands Antilles, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Uruguay, Venezuela.

languages.name: Southeastern Tepehuan
languages.area: Southeast Durango, Mezquital Municipality. Santa María Ocotán is cultural and religious center.

languages.name: Lowland Tarahumara
languages.area: Chihuahua, Guazapares, Urique, and Uruachi towns.

languages.name: Central Tarahumara
languages.area: Southwest Chihuahua, from Cuautemoc, southwest to Creel, down Urique River, east up Sinforosa Canyon, southeast to Chinantu, north to Balleza.

languages.name: Tubar
languages.area: Chihuahua, where Río San Ignacio (Verde) and Río Urique meet in southwest near Sinaloa and Sonora borders.

languages.name: Malinaltepec Me'phaa
languages.area: East Guerrero, Malinaltepec, south of Tlapa de Comonfort, Malinaltepec Municipio: Malinaltepec, El Tejocote, Moyotepec, Ojo de Agua, Paraje Montero, San Miguel el Progreso, Colombia de Guadalupe, Tilapa, Tierra Colorada, El Rincón; Iliatenco Municipio: Iliatenco, Cruztomáhuac, San José Vista Hermosa, Alchipahua, El Aserradero; San Luís Acatlán Municipio: Pueblo Hidalgo, Pascala del Oro.

languages.name: Southeastern Tarahumara
languages.area: Chihuahua, Chinatú.

languages.name: Huehuetla Tepehua
languages.area: Northeast Hidalgo, Huehuetla; Puebla, half the town of Mecapalapa.

languages.name: Tepecano
languages.area: Northwest Jalisco near Bolaños.

languages.name: Northern Tarahumara
languages.area: Chihuahua, Santa Rosa Ariseachi, Agua Caliente Ariseachi, Bilaguchi, Tomochi, La Nopalera towns.

languages.name: Upper Necaxa Totonac
languages.area: Northeast Puebla, Necaxa River Valley, Chicontla, Patla, Cacahuatlán, and San Pedro Tlalontongo towns.

languages.name: Southwestern Tepehuan
languages.area: Southwest Durango, Lajas, Taxicaringa, Teneraca.

languages.name: Yecuatla Totonac
languages.area: Near south coast, Veracruz, Yecuatla, Misantla.

languages.name: Filomena Mata-Coahuitlán Totonac
languages.area: Veracruz, highlands, middle of main highlands dialect.

languages.name: Coyutla Totonac
languages.area: Puebla, foot of mountains north of ‘Sierra Totonaca’ and Olintla River.

languages.name: Tojolabal
languages.area: Chiapas, Margaritas, Altamirano.

languages.name: Papantla Totonac
languages.area: Veracruz.

languages.name: Highland Totonac
languages.area: Zacatlán, Puebla, Veracruz.

languages.name: Azoyú Me'phaa
languages.area: Guerrero, Azoyú, east of Ometepec, Azoyú municipality: Macahuite, Maxmadí, Toxnene, Zapotitlán de la Fuente.

languages.name: Tlacoapa Me'phaa
languages.area: East Guerrero, Tlacoapa, southwest of Tlapa de Comonfort, Tlacoapa Municipio: Tlacoapa, Sabana, Tlacotepec, Laguna Seca, Tenamazapa, Totomixtlahuaca.

languages.name: Pisaflores Tepehua
languages.area: Veracruz, Pisaflores, Ixhuatlán de Madero, one other town.

languages.name: Tlachichilco Tepehua
languages.area: Veracruz, Tlachichilco.

languages.name: Acatepec Me'phaa
languages.area: Guerrero, southwest of Tlapa de Comonfort. Larger towns include Acatepec Municipality: Acatepec, Apetzuca, Barranca Pobre, Llano Grande, Mezcaltepec, Tres Cruces, Caxitepec, Xilotlancingo, El Fuereño, Escalería Zapata; Ayutla Municipality: El Salto, El Timbre, Barranca Tecoani, Acalmani.

languages.name: Western Totonac
languages.area: Puebla, Ozomatlán, Tepetzintla de Galeana, Cuahueyatla.

languages.name: Copala Triqui
languages.area: Oaxaca, Juxtlahuaca, San Juan Copala. Over 1,000 speakers: Sonora, including Miguel Alemán (both settled and seasonal); Baja California, San Quintín valley (mostly settled); Coastal California, including Greenfield; Mexico City. Smaller colonies in most tourist centers of Mexico. Also in United States.

languages.name: San Martín Itunyoso Triqui
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco.

languages.name: Chicahuaxtla Triqui
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, San José Xochistlán; Putla District, Santo Domingo del Estado.

languages.name: Tektiteko
languages.area: Area of Tectitán, Cuilco. Also in Mexico.

languages.name: Southwestern Tarahumara
languages.area: Chihuahua, Tubare.

languages.name: Tzeltal
languages.area: East central Chiapas, Oxchuc area.

languages.name: Tzotzil
languages.area: Central Chiapas, Venustiano Carranza Municipio, Venustiano Carranza, El Puerto, and El Paraiso de Grijalva towns.

languages.name: Huarijio
languages.area: West central Chihuahua, Western Sierra Madre Mountains, from Río Chinipas east to Sonora border, from San Bernardo, to headwaters of Río Mayo. 17 or more villages or hamlets.

languages.name: Venetian
languages.area: North, Venice, Tre Venezie area; Venezia Eugànea west to Verona, south to the Po, east to the border of the Fruili; Trentino-Alto Adige (Suedtirol); Venezia Giulia, east of the Friuli including Trieste. Bisiacco is in Gorizia Province. Also in Brazil, Croatia, Slovenia.

languages.name: Juxtlahuaca Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, central Santiago Juxtlahuaca, San Sebastián Tecomaxtlahuaca, San Miguel Tlacotepec, Santos Reyes Tepejillo, Santa María Tindú, San Martin Durazons, Santa María Yucunicoco towns; San Quintín valley, Baja California.

languages.name: Ixtayutla Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Jamiltepec District, Santiago Ixtayutla, Ixtayutla, El Carasol El Huamuche, La Humedad, Llano Escondido, Llano Verde, El Mosco, Pueblo Viejo, San Lucas, Xiniyuba, Yucuyá, Las Limas, Macahuite, Nuyuku, Olintepec, Yomuche, Carasul, Frutillo.

languages.name: Mitlatongo Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán, Santiago Mitlatongo, Santa Cruz Mitlatongo.

languages.name: Soyaltepec Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, northwest Tuxtepec District, part of Soyaltepec Municipio, Santa María Jacatepec and San Miguel Soyaltepec towns, Soyaltepec Island.

languages.name: Soyaltepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Teposcolula District, San Bartolo Soyaltepec, Guadalupe Gabilera villages.

languages.name: Tamazola Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán, San Juan Tamazola.

languages.name: Ayautla Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Teotitlán District, San Bartolomé Ayautla.

languages.name: Mazatlán Mazatec
languages.area: Oaxaca, south Teotitlán District, Mazatlán Villa de Flores. 32 towns and villages, also in Distrito Federal.

languages.name: Alcozauca Mixtec
languages.area: East Guerrero, near Metlatonoc. 14 villages.

languages.name: Chazumba Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, near to Puebla border. Santiago Chazumba has largest group. Some in San Pedro y San Pablo Tequixtepec (in Oaxaca), Zapotitlán, Petlalcingo, and Totoltepec de Guerrero (in Puebla) villages.

languages.name: Diuxi-Tilantongo Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, 20 towns and villages in the Diuxi and Tilantongo area, Oaxaca City, Puebla City, Mexico City.

languages.name: Sinicahua Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, San Antonio Sinicahua, Siniyucu, Sinicahua Municipio.

languages.name: San Juan Teita Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, southeast of Tlaxiaco, San Juan Teita town.

languages.name: Tijaltepec Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Tlaxiaco District, San Pablo Tijaltepec, Santa María Yosoyúa towns.

languages.name: Magdalena Peñasco Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, Santa María Magdalena Peñasco, San Cristobal Amoltepec, San Mateo Peñasco, and San Agustín Tlacotepec municipalities.

languages.name: Northern Tlaxiaco Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, San Juan Ñumí and Santiago Nundichi municipalities; Teposcolula District, San Antonino Monte Verde and San Sebastián Nicananduta municipalities.

languages.name: San Miguel Piedras Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Nochixtlán District.

languages.name: Sindihui Mixtec
languages.area: West central Oaxaca.

languages.name: Tacahua Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Tlaxiaco District, east of Yosondúa, southeast of San Miguel el Grande.

languages.name: Cuyamecalco Mixtec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Cuicatlán District, Cuyamecalco, San Miguel Santa Flor, Santa Ana Cuauhtémoc.

languages.name: Yoloxochitl Mixtec
languages.area: Southeast Guerrero, San Luís Acatlán Municipio, south of Tlapa, halfway between Metlatónoc and Ayutla Mixtec, Yoloxóchitl, and Cuanacastitlán.

languages.name: Yaqui
languages.area: Sonora. Also in United States.

languages.name: Yucateco
languages.area: Campeche, Quintana Roo, Yucatán. Also in Belize.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Sierra de Juárez Zapotec
languages.area: North Oaxaca.

languages.name: Western Tlacolula Valley Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca. Also in United States.

languages.name: Ocotlán Zapotec

languages.name: Cajonos Zapotec
languages.area: North Oaxaca, San Pedro Cajonos, San Francisco Cajonos, San Mateo Cajonos, San Miguel Cajonos, San Pablo Yaganiza, Xagacía towns. Also in United States.

languages.name: Ayoquesco Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Santa María Ayoquesco, Santa Cruz Nexila, San Andrés Zabache, San Martín Lachila.

languages.name: Isthmus Zapotec

languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Miahuatlán, halfway between Miahuatlán and coast. Most towns with ‘Ozolotepec’ in the name are included, but not San Francisco Ozolotepec.

languages.area: Northe Oaxaca, San Miguel Aloápam, San Isidro Aloápam.

languages.name: Rincón Zapotec

languages.name: Santo Domingo Albarradas Zapotec

languages.name: Tabaa Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Yatzachi Zapotec
languages.area: North central Oaxaca, Yatzachi el Bajo, Yatzachi el Alto, Xoochixtepec, Yohueche, Zoochina, Zoochila, Yalina. Also in United States.

languages.area: Oaxaca, Mitla Valley.

languages.name: Xadani Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Pochutla District, San Miguel del Puerto Municipio, Santa María Xadani. 16 towns.

languages.name: Coatecas Altas Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Ejutla.

languages.name: Copainalá Zoque

languages.name: Chimalapa Zoque
languages.area: Oaxaca, Santa María Chimalapa and San Miguel Chimalapa.

languages.name: Asunción Mixtepec Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca, southwest of Oaxaca City, Asunción Mixtepec and another town.

languages.name: Tabasco Zoque

languages.name: Rayón Zoque

languages.name: Francisco León Zoque

languages.name: Lachiguiri Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, north of Isthmus, southwest of Guevea de Humboldt. Neighboring municipalities: Santa María Totolapilla, Jalapa, and Magdalena towns.

languages.name: Yautepec Zapotec
languages.area: East Oaxaca, San Bartolo Yautepec.

languages.name: Choapan Zapotec

languages.area: North Oaxaca, Santa María Yavesía (center), Carrizal, Latuvi, Benito Juárez, Ixtlán de Juárez, Santa Catarina Lachatao, Llano Grande, La Trinidad, Nevería, San Miguel Amatlán, Capulalpan de Morelos, Santiago Xiacui, Natividad, Guelatao de Juárez.

languages.name: San Pedro Quiatoni Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca, San Pedro Quiatoni, Salinas, Unión Juárez, about 20 nearby settlements.

languages.name: Guevea De Humboldt Zapotec
languages.area: East Oaxaca.

languages.name: Totomachapan Zapotec
languages.area: West Oaxaca. 2 towns.

languages.name: Santa María Quiegolani Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca.

languages.area: Oaxaca, northeast corner of Yautepec District, northeast of Pan American highway, east of Mitla. San Carlos Yautepec Municipio: Santiago Quiavicuzas; Nejapa de Madero Municipio: San Juan Lachixila, Corral de Piedra, Carrizal; Guevea de Humboldt Municipio: Guadalupe Guevea.

languages.name: Tlacolulita Zapotec

languages.name: Lachixío Zapotec

languages.name: Santa Inés Yatzechi Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca, Zimatlán District, south of Oaxaca City, west of Ocotlán de Morelos.

languages.name: Amatlán Zapotec

languages.name: El Alto Zapotec
languages.area: West Oaxaca, San Pedro el Alto, San Antonino el Alto, San Andrés el Alto.

languages.name: Zoogocho Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Zoogocho, Yalina, Tabehua, Oaxaca City, Mexico City. Also in United States.

languages.name: Santiago Xanica Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Miahuatlán: Santiago Xanica, Santa María Coixtepec, San Andrés Lovene, San Antonio Ozolotepec.

languages.area: Oaxaca, Ejutla District, south of Oaxaca City, San Vicente Coatlán, a municipality town.

languages.name: Yalálag Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca. Also in United States.

languages.name: Chichicapan Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca.

languages.name: Zaniza Zapotec
languages.area: West Oaxaca, Santa María Zaniza, Santiago Textitlán, Santiago Xochiltepec, El Frijol, Buenavista.

languages.name: San Baltazar Loxicha Zapotec

languages.name: Mazaltepec Zapotec

languages.name: Texmelucan Zapotec
languages.area: West Oaxaca.

languages.name: Southern Rincon Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca.

languages.name: Elotepec Zapotec
languages.area: West Oaxaca, west of Zimatlán. 1 village.

languages.name: Xanaguía Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Miahuatlán: Santa Catarina Xanaguía, San Francisco Ozolotepec, and San José Ozolotepec.

languages.name: Lapaguía-Guivini Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, southeast Miahuatlán, Lapaguía, San Felipe Lachillo, La Merced del Potrero, San Juan Guivini towns.

languages.name: San Agustín Mixtepec Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Miahuatlán, San Agustín Mixtepec.

languages.name: Santa Catarina Albarradas Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Santa Catarina Albarradas (also known as San Antonio Albarradas).

languages.name: Loxicha Zapotec
languages.area: South Oaxaca, between Miahuatlán, Pochutla, and Puerto Escondido: San Andrés Paxtlán, San Miguel Suchixtepec, San Pedro el Alto, San Agustín Loxicha, San Bartolomé Loxicha, Candelaria Loxicha, San Pedro Pochutla, Santa María Colotepec, San Francisco Cozoaltepec, Santo Domingo Morelos and Santa María Tonameca.

languages.name: Quioquitani-Quierí Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Yautepec: Santa Catarina Quioquitani, Santa Catalina Quierí, Santo Tomás Quierí, Santo Domingo Lachivitó, San Pedro Leapi, Santiago Lachivía.

languages.name: Tilquiapan Zapotec
languages.area: Central Oaxaca, Ocotlán, San Miguel Tilquiapan.

languages.name: Tejalapan Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, Etla District, San Felipe Tejalapan.

languages.name: Güilá Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Dionisio Ocotepec municipality, San Pablo Güilá, Matatlan agencia.

languages.name: Zaachila Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, south Oaxaca City, past Xoxo, Zaachila, San Raymundo Jalpan, San Bartolo Coyotepec, San Pablo Cuatro Venados, and Santa María Coyotepec.

languages.name: Yatee Zapotec
languages.area: Oaxaca, San Francisco Yatee (4 towns), San Cristóbal Lachiruáj.
